Snikit the Master Assassin.About: Some say Snikit went mad after being hit in the head with a stray projectile. Others say he went mad after cracking his skull on a slippery sewer floor. Either way, this crazy Ratling rules the Assassins Guild with an iron claw (when he's lucid enough).
Snikit the Master Assassin.Event:
**Immediately:** Place Snikit 1" away from the triggering unit. He makes a Morale Check. On a success, Snikit Engages the unit that picked up the Treasure.
 
**Neutral Turn:** Snikit acts as normal. He makes Stupor Checks when attempting to Engage.
 
**Other Behaviours:** Snikit Disengages at the end of every Melee Combat.

XYZ the Vampire Count.Event:
**Immediately:** Place XYZ 1" away from the triggering unit.
 
**Neutral Turn:** XYZ acts as normal. Once he has Incapacitated a unit that is not Large, Undead, or an Animal, he will attempt to Retreat.
 
**Other Behaviours:** XYZ does not target Large, Undead, and Animal units.

XYZ the Bounty Hunter.About: This unit has a Blowpipe. The most feared Bounty Hunter in the city. XYZ rushes from the shadows and captures her targets before they're aware she's even there.
XYZ the Bounty Hunter.Event:
**Immediately:** Place XYZ on the nearest board edge. The triggering unit is the target for the purposes of the 'Bounty Hunter' skill.
 
**Neutral Turn:** XYZ moves toward the target, Engaging if possible, otherwise making a Ranged Attack if possible. Once her target is Incapacitated, she will attempt to Retreat.
 
**Other Behaviours:** XYZ uses her Disengage skill at the start of her turn if she is not Engaged with her target.

XYZ the Thief.About: Frustratingly agile, XYZ is always one step ahead of everyone else. A thief notorious amongst the nobility, she is the mastermind behind numerous high-profile heists.
XYZ the Thief.Event:
**Immediately:** Place XYZ 1" away from the triggering unit. She is holding the Treasure. She immediately makes a Move action toward the nearest board edge.
 
**Neutral Turn:** XYZ attempts to Retreat.
 
**Other Behaviours:** XYZ will attempt any Agility Check that shortens the path to the nearest board edge.

XYZ the Pit Fighter.About: The current champion of the Pits, this person's presence is preceded by the chanting of their adoring fans.
XYZ the Pit Fighter.Event:
**If the Pit Fighter was originally a member of the triggering unit's warband:**
 
**Immediately:**You found your old ally in the Pits. Time to break them out! Place the Pit Fighter 1" away from the triggering unit. Place four Fans (use the Peasant stat block from the Inquisitors warband) in a rough circle surrounding the Pit Fighter and the triggering unit. The Pit Fighter immediately comes under the control of the triggering unit's warband and the Fans are immediately hostile to that warband.
 
**Neutral Turn:** The Fans act as normal.
 
**Other Behaviours:**At the end of the game, the Pit Fighter returns to its original warband. The original, neutral Pit Fighter returns to become the new Pit Fighter.
 
**Otherwise:**
 
**Immediately:**Your unit stumbled into a Pit Fight! Place the Pit Fighter 1" away from the triggering unit. Give it an additional Treasure (in addition to the one that the triggering unit picked up). Place four Fans (use the Peasant stat block from the Inquisitors warband) in a rough circle surrounding the Pit Fighter and the triggering unit.
 
**Neutral Turn:** The Pit Fighter acts as normal, targeting the triggering unit. The Fans do nothing, unless they have become hostile to someone (then they act as normal).
 
**Other Behaviours:** If the triggering unit moves away from the Pit Fighter before the Pit Fighter is Incapacitated, or if any other unit attempts to attack or cast a Spell on the Pit Fighter or a Fan, they all become hostile toward the warband of that unit.
 
**End of the Pit Fight:** If the Pit Fighter Incapacitates the triggering unit, they do nothing from then on (unless they have become hostile to a warband, then they target that warband). At the end of the game, if the triggering unit was a hero, it becomes the Pit Fighter, otherwise it dies. If the triggering unit Incapacitates the Pit Fighter, the Fans come under the triggering player's control for the rest of the battle.

XYZ the Blight Prophet.Skills: Spread Blight (Major), Blight for the Blight God
XYZ the Blight Prophet.About: This self-proclaimed 'Prophet of the Blight God' has supposedly been sent by greater powers to spread the gift of the Blight to all who will listen, and to all who won't. Blah's sermons, and those of his followers, bring a sense of foreboding to all those unlucky enough to hear them.
XYZ the Blight Prophet.Event: Gives the plague. Has cultists nearby that have the plague. Will try to spread it as much as possible.

XYZ the Archbishop.About: As the (now disgraced) head of the church within the city, blah has been heavily criticised for allowing the Blight to spread to all corners of the city. He is commonly seen throughout the city doing his best to heal the diseased and occasionally smite the forces of Chaos.
XYZ the Archbishop.Event: Would try and cure the plague for anyone that comes within 6".

XYZ the Rebel Captain.Event: Spawn with rabble. Maybe recruits more and attack everyone. Could rout when enough are defeated. May try to steal the treasure.

XYZ the Shady Merchant.About: Has a Crossbow. This shady mercant can procure goods for you, for a fee.
XYZ the Shady Merchant.Event: Will have the treasure. Will turn hostile if attacked. Will trade another treasure for an automatic roll on the magic table.

XYZ the Sellsword.About: This sellsword can be convinced to fight for you and just as equally be convinced to fight against you.
XYZ the Sellsword.Event: Can be bribed when within 6" to join you for the fight (10g?). Opponent can then do the same.

XYZ the Grand Inquisitor.About: As the head of the inqusition, blah's job is to stamp out the evil, corruption, and rot from the city. He does so through bribery, extortion, and other forms of coercion.

XYZ the Folk Hero.About: This dwarf is a hero of the people.
XYZ the Folk Hero.Event: Appears with multiple peasants. Tries to move off the board. If a peasant dies, gain X gold.

XYZ the Wandering Knight.Event: Starts on board edge. Moves across board. Must make this check if you come within 6". Will turn hostile if you fail. Law has advantage to convince the knight to fight for them. Chaos does not have adv. Make a morale check.

XYZ the Demon Lord.Event: Tries to kill your allied faction agent (or leader if you don't have one).

XYZ the Necromancer.Event: Starts with 2 zombies. Summons one every turn. Attacks everyone.

XYZ the Berserker.Event: Comes from off the board in random direction. Attacks any in sight.

Gang Member.About: Outcast by society, Ratlings are forced into the edges of the city where they make ends meet by any means necessary. This incentivises them to skirt the law and find creative ways to feed themselves and their families.

Blightchosen.About: A faithful servant of the Blight.
